intro: Matricaria schinziana, commonly known as the Schinz's chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features finely divided, aromatic leaves. Its flowers consist of a central disk surrounded by white or pale yellow ray florets, which bloom in late summer. Matricaria schinziana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild medicinal properties similar to those of true chamomile.
